  • STORABLE MULTI-DEVICE CHARGING STATION -- Built-in 1000mAh rechargeable battery, it can be used for 10-20 days in induction mode after fully charged. The organizer charging stand can charge three LED homelife lights at once after connected the USB cable, and you can charge each motion sensor closet light individually. It's not only a charging stand, but also a good helper for storage space and keeps your desktop neat and tidy. Non-Slippery bottom prevents the charging station from sliding.
  • DIMMABLE AND TIMING -- These dimmable closet lights come with a remote. In "ON" mode, the light will turn on all the time, and it can works with the remote control. There are 2 ways of adjustable brightness: 10%/50%/100% brightness, Step-less Dimming: pressing the +/- button of the remote control. And it has Timing Function with: 10, 30, 60 or 120 mins. ( Note: the remote control do not work for "Auto Mode". )
  • MOTION & NIGHT SENSOR -- These led cabinet lights with 2 sensor modes: Night Mode and Day Mode. They can detect the motion of human in the dark or daytime. Automatically open within 10ft/120, automatically shut down after about 15 seconds after no motion is detected. Size: 8'' x 1.57'' x 0.63''.
  • EASY TO INSTALL -- It has 2 installation ways. With built-in strong magnet, you can easily attach the under cabinet lights on any iron product; Peel off the 3M adhesive tape to stick on any flat surface. No need to use screws, bid farewell to complicated installation. UPDATE: The square magnets are instead of long magnet strips.
  • WIDE APPLICATIONS AND SERVICE -- Ideal for the bedroom, closet, cabinet, workshop, garage, stairwell, hallway, storage room etc. Please contact us freely via email if there is no USB cable or magnet tapes in package, or any other issues, we will offer you a replacement after confirmed. Better Light, Better Life! KINDLY NOTE: B09PZTY75G(Size 6 Pack) is compatable for this charge station.

Product description

Lightbiz 6 Pack 30LEDs Dimmer Closet Light with Charging Station

6 Pcs dimmable closet lights come with a remote. In "ON" mode, the light will turn on all the time, and it can works with the remote control.

Lightbiz cabinet lights with 2 sensor modes: Night Mode and Day Mode. They can detect the motion of human in the dark or daytime.

It has 2 installation ways. No need to use screws, bid farewell to complicated installation.

Not only suitable for small areas, but also for large places.

Multiple Brightness Options

Dimmer function cannot be selected in "AUTO" mode.Switch to "ON" mode, press the brightness function buttons by the remote control.

Smart Timing Function

Timing function cannot be selected in "AUTO" mode. Switch to "ON" mode, press the timer function buttons by the remote control.

Energy Saving- Type C Charging

Built-in 1000mAh USB rechargeable battery, which can be charged more stably by any USB port, like plug, power bank or laptop.

Size: 8''x1.57''x0.63''

Charging Station for LED Light

  1. Save space
  2. Convenient storage
  3. Non-Slippery bottom
  4. Charge 3 lights at once
  5. Keeps desktop neat and tidy

        Just installed these motion-sensing LED lights and they're way more versatile than I expected. Got a 6-pack and ended up using them in different spots - under my desk, beneath the credenza for some workspace lighting, and out in the garage by the workbench.

        The mounting system is pretty clever. Each light has a magnet on the back, but they also give you stick-on metal plates for non-magnetic surfaces. No drilling or permanent mounts needed - just stick and click. Makes it super easy to take them down for recharging too.

        Love that they're USB-C rechargeable and actually smart about when they work. I've got mine set to only activate in dark conditions with motion, but you can run them constantly if you want.         Something I share in all my reviews - I rate products on a simple idea - what am I getting for my money? That's why this gets 5 stars. Not because they're the fanciest LED lights out there, but because they deliver exactly what I needed at a price that makes sense.

        Bottom line: Perfect for adding some smart lighting anywhere you need it. The motion sensing works well, installation's a breeze, and having six in the pack means you can tackle several spots at once.

        Bright Multi-Mode Lights With Charging Issues
        Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2024

        I really like -or did like these lights. So much that after the first set of six I bought a second set, then a third. I'm afraid I'm now finding it increasingly difficult and annoying to charge them. The charge lasts reasonably enough for my usage -I only turn them... See more
        I really like -or did like these lights. So much that after the first set of six I bought a second set, then a third. I'm afraid I'm now finding it increasingly difficult and annoying to charge them. The charge lasts reasonably enough for my usage -I only turn them on at night, and they're not constantly on. I make a point to just proactively charge them once a week so I'm not caught out after the battery dies. It's increasingly hard to charge them, though. When you put them in the charger they turn red until they're fully charged and then they're green. It's getting harder to get them to charge in that you put them in and maybe one of three turns red. The others don't seem to be read by the charger. I'm constantly having to try to move them around to get all three to charge. It can take up to five minutes because you touch one, and lo and behold the one that was engaged and charging suddenly doesn't charge. The dock for each charger is obviously too big, which allows the light to tilt a bit left, right, front or back, and so become disengaged. It's back and forth with the three of them until they're all showing red and charging. It's become so aggravating. I also dislike that this is a six-pack set, yet the charger only holds three at a time. Give me a charger that holds all six so I can charge them and be done with it. Now, one of the 18 won't seem to charge at all via the charger, so that one I have to plug in directly at the bottom, i.e. not use the charger at all. But at least each light does have a USB input at the bottom. Next time maybe I'll find a small book to lay on top of the lights while in the charger to see if that helps. My first set was purchased on May 25, 2024, so a little over 4 months ago. It doesn't bode well for the others I'm afraid.

        Pros:
        When charged, they work great, brightness can be adjusted, there are different modes

        Cons:
        Everything about charging

        Suggestions for the manufacturer:
        1. If we're buying a six pack, give us a charger that charges all six at once
        2. Fix the aggravating charger issues
